Shuffle

May 11, 2011

True randomness doesn't always feel random. People swear up and down that their iPods, when placed on shuffle, favor certain songs over others.This isn't device error, but user error. The iPod doesn't keep track of the songs it played before. After each song ends, it just scans the list and picks another track at random. Since it's ignorant of which song played five songs ago, that song is fair game...as are any other songs off...

With learning to walk and motor functions, there is a lot to take in.In the second year of your life, you can only learn half that much.
